Key Match Events: Julian Alvarez scored the opening goal in the 48th minute.
Lautaro Martinez doubled Argentina's lead in the 87th minute.
Julian Alvarez capitalized on a goal being unguarded after Mac Allister collided with Crepeau in the box.
Pre-Game Insights: Leo Messi will wear the captain's armband as he leads his team against Canada.
Argentina is looking sharp with their passes.
Canada suffered a 4-0 loss to Netherlands in a friendly and drew scoreless against France in their latest outing.
Leo Messi now holds the record for the most appearances in Copa America history.
Post-Match Reflections: Emiliano Martinez responded with a save on the other end, keeping his clean sheet.
Argentina secured a 2-0 win over Canada to gain three points and top position in Group A.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Canada kick off from center field at Mercedes-Benz Stadium to begin the tournament.
Sergio Aguero presented the Copa America trophy.
Argentina fans are making their presence felt outside Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta.
